item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: {#DATABASE} - Keys average time-to-live
item_prototype.description: Average time-to-live of keys in current database

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: {#DATABASE} - Expired keys
item_prototype.description: Number of keys with an expiration in current database

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: {#DATABASE} - Keys
item_prototype.description: Number of keys in current database

trigger_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: no new keys in {#DATABASE}

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Slowlogs - Events count
item_prototype.description: Slow logs events count

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Slowlogs - Events details
item_prototype.description: Slow logs events details

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Number of reallocations
item_prototype.description: Number of value reallocations performed by active the defragmentation process

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Number of defragmented keys
item_prototype.description: Number of keys that were actively defragmented

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Number of defrag skipped keys
item_prototype.description: Number of keys that were skipped by the active defragmentation process

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Number of aborted reallocations
item_prototype.description: Number of aborted value reallocations started by the active defragmentation process

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Defragmentation status
item_prototype.description: Flag indicating if active defragmentation is active

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Memory allocated by active allocator
item_prototype.description: The memory allocated by active allocator

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Memory allocated by allocator
item_prototype.description: The memory allocated by allocator

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Memory fragmentation by allocator
item_prototype.description: The memory fragmentation by allocator

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Allocator fragmentation ratio
item_prototype.description: The ratio of fragmentation to allocated by allocator memory

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Memory allocated by resident allocator
item_prototype.description: The memory allocated by resident allocator

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Memory rss by allocator
item_prototype.description: The memory rss by allocator

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Allocator rss ratio
item_prototype.description: The ratio of rss to allocated by allocator memory

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Persistence - AOF current rewrite ops duration
item_prototype.description: Duration of the on-going AOF rewrite operation if any

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Persistence - AOF logging status
item_prototype.description: Flag indicating AOF logging is activated

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Persistence - AOF last rewrite status
item_prototype.description: Status of the last AOF rewrite operation

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Persistence - AOF size of c-o-w allocations
item_prototype.description: The size in bytes of copy-on-write allocations during the last AOF rewrite operation

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Persistence - AOF last rewrite ops duration
item_prototype.description: Duration of the last AOF rewrite operation in seconds

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Persistence - AOF last write status
item_prototype.description: Status of the last write operation to the AOF

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Persistence - AOF logging rewrite ops
item_prototype.description: Flag indicating a AOF rewrite operation is on-going

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Persistence - AOF logging rewrite ops scheduled
item_prototype.description: Flag indicating an AOF rewrite operation will be scheduled once the on-going RDB save is complete.

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Clients - Blocked clients
item_prototype.description: Number of clients pending on a blocking call (BLPOP, BRPOP, BRPOPLPUSH)

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Clients - Client biggest input buffer
item_prototype.description: Biggest input buffer among current client connections

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Clients - Client longest output list
item_prototype.description: Longest output list among current client connections

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Cluster - Cluster enabled
item_prototype.description: Indicate Redis cluster is enabled

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Clients - Connected clients
item_prototype.description: Number of client connections (excluding connections from slaves)

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Replication - Connected slaves
item_prototype.description: Number of connected slaves

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Number of evicted keys
item_prototype.description: Number of evicted keys due to maxmemory limit

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Number of expired keys
item_prototype.description: Total number of key expiration events

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Percent of expired keys
item_prototype.description: Percent of key expiration events

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Count of expired keys with time cap
item_prototype.description: Count of key expiration events that reached time cap

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Net input, kbps
item_prototype.description: The network's read rate per second in KB/sec

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Commands processed, ups
item_prototype.description: This command per second

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Net output, kbps
item_prototype.description: The network's write rate per second in KB/sec

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Number of succesfull lookup of keys
item_prototype.description: Number of successful lookup of keys in the main dictionary

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Number of failed lookup of keys
item_prototype.description: Number of failed lookup of keys in the main dictionary

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Latest fork duration, ms
item_prototype.description: Duration of the latest fork operation in microseconds (converted to milliseconds)

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Lazyfree objects
item_prototype.description: The number of objects waiting to be freed (as a result of calling UNLINK, or FLUSHDB and FLUSHALL with the ASYNC option)

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Persistence - Loading of a dump file
item_prototype.description: Flag indicating if the load of a dump file is on-going

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Replication - Master host
item_prototype.description: If the instance is a slave: Host or IP address of the master

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Replication - Master last interaction
item_prototype.description: If the instance is a slave: Number of seconds since the last interaction with master

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Replication - Master link status
item_prototype.description: If the instance is a slave: Status of the link between instance and master node (up/down)

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Replication - Master port
item_prototype.description: If the instance is a slave: Master listening TCP port

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Replication - Master replication ID
item_prototype.description: The replication ID of the Redis server, if it is a master

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Replication - Master enslaved replication ID
item_prototype.description: The repliation ID of the Redis server's master, if it is enslaved

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Replication - Replication offset
item_prototype.description: The server's current replication offset

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Replication - Master sync status
item_prototype.description: If the instance is a slave: Indicate the master is syncing to the slave

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Replication - Master sync last transfer I/O
item_prototype.description: If a SYNC operation is on-going: Number of seconds since last transfer I/O during a SYNC operation

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Replication - Master sync bytes left
item_prototype.description: If a SYNC operation is on-going: Number of bytes left before syncing is complete

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Max memory
item_prototype.description: The value of the maxmemory configuration directive

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Max memory policy
item_prototype.description: The value of the maxmemory-policy configuration directive

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Allocator
item_prototype.description: Memory allocator, chosen at compile time

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Fragmentation ratio
item_prototype.description: Ratio between used_memory_rss and used_memory

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Number of sockets open for migrate
item_prototype.description: The number of sockets open for MIGRATE purposes

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Server - Event loop mechanism
item_prototype.description: Event loop mechanism used by Redis

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Number of channels with client sub
item_prototype.description: Global number of pub/sub channels with client subscriptions

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Number of patterns with client sub
item_prototype.description: Global number of pub/sub pattern with client subscriptions

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Persistence - RDB save is on-going
item_prototype.description: Flag indicating a RDB save is on-going

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Persistence - Number of changes since last dump
item_prototype.description: Number of changes since the last dump

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Persistence - Current RDB save ops duration
item_prototype.description: Duration of the on-going RDB save operation if any

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Persistence - Last RDB save status
item_prototype.description: Status of the last RDB save operation

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Persistence - Last RDB save ops duration
item_prototype.description: Duration of the last RDB save operation in seconds

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Persistence - RDB size of c-o-w allocations
item_prototype.description: The size in bytes of copy-on-write allocations during the last RBD save operation

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Persistence - Last time of RDB save ops
item_prototype.description: Epoch-based timestamp of last successful RDB save

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Server - Redis mode
item_prototype.description: The server's mode ("standalone", "sentinel" or "cluster")

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Server - Redis version
item_prototype.description: Version of the Redis server

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Connections rejected
item_prototype.description: Number of connections rejected because of "maxclients" limit

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Replication - Replication backlog status
item_prototype.description: Flag indicating replication backlog is active

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Replication - Replication backlog offset
item_prototype.description: The master offset of the replication backlog buffer

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Replication - Replication backlog data size
item_prototype.description: Size in bytes of the data in the replication backlog buffer

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Replication - Replication backlog size
item_prototype.description: Total size in bytes of the replication backlog buffer

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Replication - Server role
item_prototype.description: Value is "master" if the instance is slave of no one, or "slave" if the instance is enslaved to master. Note that a slave can be master of another slave (daisy chaining)

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Memory RSS overhead
item_prototype.description: The memory RSS overhead

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - RSS overhead ratio
item_prototype.description: The ratio of RSS to overhead memory

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Replication - Replication offset accepted
item_prototype.description: The offset up to which replication IDs are accepted

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Number of keys tracked for expire
item_prototype.description: The number of keys tracked for expiry purposes (applicable only to writable slaves)

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Replication - Slave priority
item_prototype.description: If the instance is a slave: The priority of the instance as a candidate for failover

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Replication - Slave read only status
item_prototype.description: If the instance is a slave: Flag indicating if the slave is read-only

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Replication - Slave replication offset
item_prototype.description: If the instance is a slave: The replication offset of the slave instance

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Number of full resyncs
item_prototype.description: The number of full resyncs with slaves

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Number of denied resync req
item_prototype.description: The number of denied partial resync requests

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Number of accepted resync req
item_prototype.description: The number of accepted partial resync requests

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Total commands processed
item_prototype.description: Total number of commands processed by the server

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Total connections received
item_prototype.description: Total number of connections accepted by the server

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Total net input
item_prototype.description: The total number of bytes read from the network

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Stats - Total net output
item_prototype.description: The total number of bytes written to the network

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Total memory
item_prototype.description: The total amount of memory that the Redis host has

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Server - Redis uptime
item_prototype.description: Number of seconds since Redis server start

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: CPU - System CPU consumed
item_prototype.description: System CPU consumed by the Redis server

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: CPU - System CPU consumed background
item_prototype.description: System CPU consumed by the background processes

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: CPU - User CPU consumed
item_prototype.description: User CPU consumed by the Redis server

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: CPU - User CPU consumed background
item_prototype.description: User CPU consumed by the background processes

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Used memory
item_prototype.description: Total number of bytes allocated by Redis using its allocator (either standard libc, jemalloc, or an alternative allocator such as tcmalloc)

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Used memory dataset
item_prototype.description: The size in bytes of the dataset (used_memory_overhead subtracted from used_memory)

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Used memory dataset, %
item_prototype.description: The percentage of used_memory_dataset out of the net memory usage (used_memory minus used_memory_startup)

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Used memory lua
item_prototype.description: Number of bytes used by the Lua engine

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Used memory overhead
item_prototype.description: The sum in bytes of all overheads that the server allocated for managing its internal data structures

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Used memory peak
item_prototype.description: Peak memory consumed by Redis (in bytes)

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Used memory peak, %
item_prototype.description: The percentage of used_memory_peak out of used_memory

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Used memory RSS
item_prototype.description: Number of bytes that Redis allocated as seen by the operating system (a.k.a resident set size). This is the number reported by tools such as top(1) and ps(1)

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Memory - Used memory startup
item_prototype.description: Initial amount of memory consumed by Redis at startup in bytes

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: Server - DB size on disk
item_prototype.description: Redis DB size on disk

trigger_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: bad status of last AOF rewrite ops
{#INSTANCE}: bad status of last AOF write ops
{#INSTANCE}: bad status of last RDB save ops
{#INSTANCE}: defragmentaion active
{#INSTANCE}: dump file loading
{#INSTANCE}: last interaction with master was more than {$MASTER_IO_TIME} sec ago
{#INSTANCE}: link with master is down
{#INSTANCE}: low cache hit ratio
trigger_prototype.description: If the cache hit ratio is lower than ~0.8 then a significant amount of the requested keys are evicted, expired, or do not exist at all. It is crucial to watch this metric while using Redis as a cache. Lower cache hit ratio results in larger latency as most of the requests are fetching data from the disk. It indicates that you need to increase the size of Redis cache to improve your application’s performance.

trigger_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: memory fragmentaion detected
trigger_prototype.description: If the ratio of ‘memory_rss’ to ‘memory_used’ is greater than ~1.5, then it signifies memory fragmentation. The fragmented memory can be recovered by restarting the server.

trigger_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: new blocked clients
{#INSTANCE}: number of connected clients was changed
{#INSTANCE}: number of connected slaves was changed
{#INSTANCE}: number of expired keys > {$EXPIRED_KEYS}
{#INSTANCE}: number of rejected connections is grow up
{#INSTANCE}: server role was changed
{#INSTANCE}: too big used memory delta in last 1 day (max)
trigger_prototype.description: Use if you have "maxmemory" limit in .conf

trigger_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: too big used memory delta in last 1 day (total)
trigger_prototype.description: Use if you no have "maxmemory" limit in .conf

trigger_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: too big used memory delta in last 5 minutes
{#INSTANCE}: too long current RDB save ops
{#INSTANCE}: used memory close to max memory limit (20%)
trigger_prototype.description: Use if you have "maxmemory" limit in .conf

trigger_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: used memory close to max memory limit (40%)
trigger_prototype.description: Use if you have "maxmemory" limit in .conf

dependency.name: {#INSTANCE}: used memory close to max memory limit (20%)

trigger_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: used memory close to total memory limit (20%)
trigger_prototype.description: Use if you no have "maxmemory" limit in .conf

trigger_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: used memory close to total memory limit (40%)
trigger_prototype.description: Use if you no have "maxmemory" limit in .conf

dependency.name: {#INSTANCE}: used memory close to total memory limit (20%)

graph_prototype.name: Redis commands in {#INSTANCE}: Total calls per second

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: {#COMMAND} - Calls, total
item_prototype.description: Total calls of this command

item_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: {#COMMAND} - Latency, ms
item_prototype.description: Latency of command execution

trigger_prototype.name: {#INSTANCE}: high latency of {#COMMAND}
